leanne_erbs: Bondi Sands has a variety of products including a tan eraser just in case.
_vickin_: Le tan has a back tan mitt. U think this is weird but it works! I got mine at kmart and they sell them in priceline too
joeyhaes: St Tropez or if you are going to UK St Moritz
becca_b00m: Bondi Sands liquid gold! So good and doesn’t destroy your clothes or sheets!
ksmilie: Bondi sands on a Thursday night for a lovely glow all weekend-it’s “proper” Tan, like need a tanning mitt and back applicator. Palmer’s tanning moisturiser is my other go to. littlepartydress: I’m too scared to do my own! I get a spray tan fortnightly... there’s a beautician under my apartment, I don’t have to waddle too far afterwards! 🙈😹 Or I use St Tropez gradual tan for a top up 👌🏼
freerange_mum: Bondi sands Its very similar to model co but not so fake dark and doesnt seem to go patchy as it fades
angeeela_84: Bondi Sands! I’ve never had a bad or streaky tan
clairseymour: Bindi sands, ultra dark, two layers 😏 (if you dare)
sunshineandpudding: Bondi Sands, Dark. Get the long thin fabric strip with loops on each end to do your back rather than the paddle type (I find the paddle one annoying AF to use). To set your tan so you feel less sticky, a light dust with baby power applied with a brush takes the tack off. Bondi Sands 1h express is also great in a rush but it’s hard to blend so work quickly!

lizzylove89: Bondi sands! And they also have a back applicator but if you don’t have that, grab your wooden spoon from kitchen, pop your tan mitt over it, secure with an elastic band & away you go 🙃
